title: mediationverse Package Development
text: mediationverse comprehensive R package ecosystem causal mediation analysis. Core principles: - Unified interface: Consistent API across different mediation methods - Modern R: S7 object system, tidyverse-compatible - Rigorous methods: Implement state--art causal inference techniques - Pedagogical: Clear documentation applied researchers

previous_headings: R Code Standards > S7 Object System Guidelines
title: mediationverse Package Development
code: # GOOD - Complete S7 class with validator MediationResult <- new_class(   name = "MediationResult",   properties = list(     direct_effect = class_double,     indirect_effect = class_double,     total_effect = class_double,     standard_errors = class_double,     confidence_intervals = class_matrix   ),   validator = function(self) {     # CRITICAL: Always include validators     if (length(self@standard_errors) == 0) {       return("Standard errors cannot be empty")     }     if (any(self@standard_errors < 0)) {       return("Standard errors must be non-negative")     }     if (!all(is.finite(c(self@direct_effect, self@indirect_effect)))) {       return("Effects must be finite")     }   } )  # BAD - Missing validator BadClass <- new_class(   name = "BadClass",   properties = list(x = class_double)   # Missing validator! )

title: mediationverse Package Development
code:
# GOOD - Proper generic and method method(print, MediationResult) <- function(x, ...) {   cat("Mediation Analysis Results
")   cat("Direct Effect:", format(x@direct_effect, digits = 3), "
")   cat("Indirect Effect:", format(x@indirect_effect, digits = 3), "
") }  # BAD - Using old S3 style in S7 package print.MediationResult <- function(x, ...) { }  # Don't do this!

title: mediationverse Package Development
text: EVERY exported function MUST include:
code: #' @title Brief one-line description #' @description Longer description with statistical details #' @param outcome Character. Name of outcome variable #' @param mediator Character. Name of mediator variable #' @param treatment Character. Name of treatment variable #' @param data Data frame containing all variables #' @return S7 object of class MediationResult containing: #'   \item{direct_effect}{Natural direct effect estimate} #'   \item{indirect_effect}{Natural indirect effect estimate} #'   \item{standard_errors}{Bootstrap standard errors} #' @examples #' \dontrun{ #'   # Simulate data #'   set.seed(123) #'   n <- 500 #'   data <- simulate_mediation_data(n = n) #'    #'   # Fit mediation model #'   fit <- mediate( #'     outcome = "Y", #'     mediator = "M",  #'     treatment = "A", #'     data = data #'   ) #'   print(fit) #' } #' @references  #' VanderWeele, T. J. (2015). Explanation in Causal Inference: Methods for  #' Mediation and Interaction. Oxford University Press. #' @export

title: mediationverse Package Development
code: # GOOD calculate_natural_effects <- function(outcome, mediator, treatment,                                        data, confounders = NULL) {   # Input validation   stopifnot(     is.character(outcome), length(outcome) == 1,     is.character(mediator), length(mediator) == 1,     is.data.frame(data)   )      # Clear variable names   outcome_model <- fit_outcome_model(data, outcome, mediator, treatment)   mediator_model <- fit_mediator_model(data, mediator, treatment)      # Compute effects   effects <- compute_effects(outcome_model, mediator_model)      return(effects) }  # BAD - Poor style calcNatEff <- function(y,m,a,d,c=NULL) {  # Unclear names   x=lm(d[,y]~d[,m]+d[,a])  # No spaces, unclear   # No input validation   return(x) }

title: mediationverse Package Development
code: # tests/testthat/test-mediation.R  test_that("mediate() handles continuous mediator correctly", {   # Arrange   set.seed(123)   n <- 200   data <- simulate_continuous_mediator(n)      # Act   result <- mediate(     outcome = "Y",     mediator = "M",     treatment = "A",      data = data   )      # Assert   expect_s7_class(result, "MediationResult")   expect_true(is.finite(result@direct_effect))   expect_true(is.finite(result@indirect_effect))   expect_length(result@standard_errors, 2) })  test_that("mediate() throws error with missing data", {   data <- data.frame(Y = c(1, 2, NA), M = c(1, 2, 3), A = c(0, 1, 0))      expect_error(     mediate(outcome = "Y", mediator = "M", treatment = "A", data = data),     "Missing values detected"   ) })

title: mediationverse Package Development
text: ALWAYS test scenarios: - Missing data (NA values) - Zero variance variables - Perfect collinearity - Singular covariance matrices - Empty data frames - Single observation - Character vs factor variables - Different treatment types (binary, continuous, categorical) - Confounders missing values - Interaction terms - Non-standard variable names (spaces, special characters)

title: mediationverse Package Development
text: complex output:
code: test_that("print method produces correct output", {   result <- create_test_mediation_result()   expect_snapshot(print(result)) })

title: mediationverse Package Development
text: EVERY mediation function MUST clearly document required assumptions: 1. Sequential ignorability: unmeasured confounding 2. Positivity: combinations treatment/mediator positive probability 3. Consistency: Well-defined interventions 4. Cross-world independence (natural effects) Include assumption checking functions possible:
code: check_positivity(data, treatment, mediator) assess_overlap(data, treatment, confounders)

title: mediationverse Package Development
text: Use standard notation VanderWeele (2015): - NDE: Natural Direct Effect - NIE: Natural Indirect Effect - TE: Total Effect (TE = NDE + NIE rare outcome assumption) - PM: Proportion Mediated

title: mediationverse Package Development
text: Support multiple inference approaches: - Delta method: Fast, asymptotic - Bootstrap: Robust, computationally intensive - Use boot package parallel = "multicore" - Default B = 1000, allow user specify - Monte Carlo: complex mediation models - Bayesian: Via brms rstan interfaces (future)

T can be overwritten  # Partial matching in data frame subsetting data[, "outcome"]  # Can be ambiguous

code: # Use :: notation my_function <- function(data) {   dplyr::mutate(data, x = 1) }  # Save and restore options my_function <- function() {   old_opts <- options(scipen = 999)   on.exit(options(old_opts), add = TRUE)   # ... code ... }  # Use TRUE/FALSE if (isTRUE(x)) { }  # Exact column matching data[, "outcome", drop = FALSE]

code: # Template for parallel bootstrap bootstrap_ci <- function(data, B = 1000, parallel = TRUE) {   ncores <- if (parallel) parallel::detectCores() - 1 else 1      boot_results <- parallel::mclapply(     seq_len(B),     function(b) {       boot_data <- data[sample(nrow(data), replace = TRUE), ]       compute_effect(boot_data)     },     mc.cores = ncores   )      unlist(boot_results) }

code: # Fork the repository on GitHub # Clone your fork git clone https://github.com/YOUR-USERNAME/mediationverse.git cd mediationverse  # Add upstream remote git remote add upstream https://github.com/data-wise/mediationverse.git  # Install dependencies Rscript -e 'remotes::install_deps(dependencies = TRUE)'

title: Contributing to mediationverse
text: Branch naming: - feature/description - New features - fix/description - Bug fixes - docs/description - Documentation - test/description - Tests
code: # Fetch latest changes git fetch upstream git checkout dev git merge upstream/dev  # Create feature branch git checkout -b feature/your-feature-name

code: # Load package devtools::load_all()  # Make your changes # Write tests # Update documentation  # Check package devtools::check()

title: Contributing to mediationverse
text: Write clear commit messages: Commit message format: - feat: - New feature - fix: - Bug fix - docs: - Documentation - test: - Tests - refactor: - Code refactoring - style: - Code style (formatting) - chore: - Maintenance
code: git add . git commit -m "feat: add support for multiple mediators  - Implement SerialMediationData class - Add extraction method for lavaan - Update documentation with examples  Closes #123"

title: Contributing to mediationverse
text: Pull request checklist: - [ ] Tests pass (devtools::test()) - [ ] R CMD check passes (devtools::check()) - [ ] Documentation updated - [ ] NEWS.md updated - [ ] Code follows style guide - [ ] Commits clear atomic
code: # Push to your fork git push origin feature/your-feature-name  # Open pull request on GitHub # Target: dev branch (not main!)

title: Contributing to mediationverse
text: Follow tidyverse style guide specifics: Naming: - Functions: snake_case() (e.g., extract_mediation()) - Variables: snake_case (e.g., med_data) - S7 Classes: CamelCase (e.g., MediationData) - Private functions: .snake_case() (e.g., .fit_mediation_glm()) Code organization:
code: # Function template my_function <- function(x, y, method = "default") {   # 1. Input validation   checkmate::assert_numeric(x)   checkmate::assert_character(method)   checkmate::assert_choice(method, c("default", "alternative"))    # 2. Main logic   result <- compute_something(x, y)    # 3. Return   result }

title: Contributing to mediationverse
code: #' Extract Mediation Structure from Models #' #' @description #' Extracts path coefficients and variance-covariance matrix from fitted #' models for mediation analysis. #' #' @param object Fitted model object (lm, glm, lavaan) #' @param treatment Character: name of treatment variable #' @param mediator Character: name of mediator variable #' @param ... Additional arguments passed to methods #' #' @return A [MediationData] object containing: #' - `a_path`: Treatment → Mediator effect #' - `b_path`: Mediator → Outcome effect #' - `c_prime`: Direct effect #' - `vcov`: Variance-covariance matrix #' #' @details #' This function is a generic with methods for different model types. #' See individual method documentation for details. #' #' @examples #' \dontrun{ #' fit_m <- lm(M ~ X, data = mydata) #' fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M, data = mydata) #' med_data <- extract_mediation(fit_m, model_y = fit_y, #'                               treatment = "X", mediator = "M") #' } #' #' @seealso [MediationData], [fit_mediation()] #' @export extract_mediation <- S7::new_generic("extract_mediation", "object")

title: Contributing to mediationverse
text: Write tests new functionality:
code: # tests/testthat/test-extraction.R test_that("extract_mediation works for lm", {   # Setup   set.seed(123)   data <- data.frame(X = rnorm(100), M = rnorm(100), Y = rnorm(100))   fit_m <- lm(M ~ X, data = data)   fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M, data = data)    # Execute   result <- extract_mediation(fit_m, model_y = fit_y,                                treatment = "X", mediator = "M")    # Verify   expect_s3_class(result, "MediationData")   expect_true(!is.na(result@a_path))   expect_true(!is.na(result@b_path))   expect_equal(nrow(result@vcov), 2) })  test_that("extract_mediation validates inputs", {   fit <- lm(Y ~ X, data = data.frame(X = 1:10, Y = 1:10))    expect_error(extract_mediation(fit, treatment = "Z"),                "treatment.*not found") })

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
text: mediationverse collection R packages mediation analysis. provides unified ecosystem model fitting, effect size computation, confidence interval estimation, sensitivity analysis, simulation studies. vignette introduces core concepts shows get started mediationverse ecosystem.

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
text: Install mediationverse meta-package GitHub: install core packages: medfit - Infrastructure (S7 classes, model fitting, extraction, bootstrap) probmed - Probabilistic effect size (P_med) RMediation - Confidence intervals (Distribution Product, MBCO) medrobust - Sensitivity analysis (bounds, falsification) medsim - Simulation infrastructure
code: # Install with pak (recommended) pak::pak("data-wise/mediationverse")  # Or with remotes remotes::install_github("data-wise/mediationverse")

title: Getting Started with mediationverse
text: mediationverse follows consistent workflow mediation analysis: Using medfit, fit mediator outcome models: Extract path coefficients covariance matrix: MediationData object, can use ecosystem packages:
code: # Fit models fit_m <- lm(M ~ X + C, data = mydata) fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M + C, data = mydata) med_data <- extract_mediation(   fit_m,   model_y = fit_y,   treatment = "X",   mediator = "M" )  # View the extracted structure print(med_data) # Distribution of Product method ci_dop <- ci(med_data, type = "dop")  # Monte Carlo method ci_mc <- ci(med_data, type = "MC", n.mc = 10000) # Compute P_med pmed_result <- compute_pmed(med_data) # Bounds for unmeasured confounding bounds <- sensitivity_bounds(med_data) # Nonparametric bootstrap boot_result <- bootstrap_mediation(med_data, n_boot = 2000)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: vignette demonstrates complete mediation analysis workflow using packages mediationverse ecosystem. : Simulate data known ground truth Fit mediation models Extract mediation structure Compute confidence intervals Calculate effect sizes Perform sensitivity analysis Bootstrap inference

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
code: library(mediationverse)  # Set seed for reproducibility set.seed(2025)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Using medsim, generate data known population parameters:
code: # Population parameters a_true <- 0.5 # X -> M effect b_true <- 0.4 # M -> Y effect c_prime_true <- 0.2 # X -> Y direct effect  # True indirect effect indirect_true <- a_true * b_true cat("True indirect effect:", indirect_true, "\n")  # Simulate data using medsim sim_data <- simulate_mediation(   n = 200,   a = a_true,   b = b_true,   c_prime = c_prime_true,   sigma_m = 1,   sigma_y = 1 )  head(sim_data)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Fit mediator outcome models using standard regression:
code: # Mediator model: M ~ X fit_m <- lm(M ~ X, data = sim_data)  # Outcome model: Y ~ X + M fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M, data = sim_data)  # View summaries summary(fit_m) summary(fit_y)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Using medfit, extract mediation paths standardized object:
code:
med_data <- extract_mediation(   fit_m,   model_y = fit_y,   treatment = "X",   mediator = "M" )  # View the extracted structure print(med_data)  # Access individual paths cat("Estimated a path:", med_data@a_path, "
") cat("Estimated b path:", med_data@b_path, "
") cat("Estimated c' path:", med_data@c_prime, "
") cat("Estimated indirect effect:", med_data@a_path * med_data@b_path, "
")

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Use RMediation compute confidence intervals indirect effect: accurate method normal theory CIs: Simulation-based CIs work distribution:
code: ci_dop <- ci(med_data, type = "dop", level = 0.95) print(ci_dop) ci_mc <- ci(med_data, type = "MC", n.mc = 10000, level = 0.95) print(ci_mc) # Create comparison table ci_comparison <- data.frame(   Method = c("DOP", "Monte Carlo"),   Lower = c(ci_dop$CI[1], ci_mc$CI[1]),   Upper = c(ci_dop$CI[2], ci_mc$CI[2]),   Width = c(diff(ci_dop$CI), diff(ci_mc$CI)) )  print(ci_comparison)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: accurate method normal theory CIs:
code: ci_dop <- ci(med_data, type = "dop", level = 0.95) print(ci_dop)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Simulation-based CIs work distribution:
code: ci_mc <- ci(med_data, type = "MC", n.mc = 10000, level = 0.95) print(ci_mc)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
code: # Create comparison table ci_comparison <- data.frame(   Method = c("DOP", "Monte Carlo"),   Lower = c(ci_dop$CI[1], ci_mc$CI[1]),   Upper = c(ci_dop$CI[2], ci_mc$CI[2]),   Width = c(diff(ci_dop$CI), diff(ci_mc$CI)) )  print(ci_comparison)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Compute P_med, probability positive indirect effect:
code: pmed_result <- compute_pmed(med_data) print(pmed_result)  # P_med interpretation: # - 0.5 = no evidence of effect (coin flip) # - > 0.8 = strong evidence of positive effect # - < 0.2 = strong evidence of negative effect

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Assess robustness unmeasured confounding:
code: # Compute sensitivity bounds sens_bounds <- sensitivity_bounds(   med_data,   rho_range = c(-0.5, 0.5) # Range of confounding )  print(sens_bounds)  # Falsification test falsification <- falsify_mediation(med_data, threshold = 0.1) print(falsification)

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Perform bootstrap inference indirect effect:
code: # Nonparametric bootstrap boot_result <- bootstrap_mediation(   med_data,   n_boot = 2000,   method = "nonparametric",   ci_level = 0.95 )  print(boot_result)  # Access bootstrap distribution hist(boot_result@boot_estimates,   main = "Bootstrap Distribution of Indirect Effect",   xlab = "Indirect Effect (a * b)",   col = "steelblue",   border = "white" ) abline(v = indirect_true, col = "red", lwd = 2, lty = 2) abline(v = boot_result@estimate, col = "blue", lwd = 2) legend("topright",   legend = c("True value", "Estimate"),   col = c("red", "blue"),   lwd = 2,   lty = c(2, 1) )

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
code:
# Compile all results results <- list(   # Point estimates   estimates = list(     a = med_data@a_path,     b = med_data@b_path,     indirect = med_data@a_path * med_data@b_path,     direct = med_data@c_prime   ),    # Confidence intervals   ci_dop = ci_dop$CI,   ci_mc = ci_mc$CI,   ci_boot = c(boot_result@ci_lower, boot_result@ci_upper),    # Effect size   pmed = pmed_result$pmed,    # Sensitivity   sensitivity = sens_bounds )  # Pretty print cat("=== Mediation Analysis Results ===

") cat("Point Estimates:
") cat("  a path (X -> M):", round(results$estimates$a, 3), "
") cat("  b path (M -> Y):", round(results$estimates$b, 3), "
") cat("  c' path (X -> Y):", round(results$estimates$direct, 3), "
") cat("  Indirect effect:", round(results$estimates$indirect, 3), "

")  cat("95% Confidence Intervals for Indirect Effect:
") cat("  DOP:", round(results$ci_dop, 3), "
") cat("  Monte Carlo:", round(results$ci_mc, 3), "
") cat("  Bootstrap:", round(results$ci_boot, 3), "

")  cat("Effect Size:
") cat("  P_med:", round(results$pmed, 3), "

")

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: Based analysis: Point Estimate: indirect effect estimate close true value 0.20. Confidence Intervals: three methods (DOP, Monte Carlo, Bootstrap) provide similar intervals, suggesting robust inference. Effect Size: P_med > 0.8 indicates strong evidence indirect effect positive. Sensitivity: effect remains significant across reasonable levels unmeasured confounding.

title: Complete Mediation Analysis Workflow
text: mediationverse also supports structural equation models:
code: library(lavaan)  # Specify mediation model model <- "   # Regressions   M ~ a*X   Y ~ b*M + c*X    # Indirect effect   indirect := a*b "  # Fit model fit_lavaan <- sem(model, data = sim_data)  # Extract mediation structure med_data_lavaan <- extract_mediation(fit_lavaan)  # Use same analysis pipeline ci_lavaan <- ci(med_data_lavaan, type = "dop") print(ci_lavaan)

title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R
code: # Install mediationverse pak::pak("data-wise/mediationverse")  # Load all packages at once library(mediationverse)  # Fit mediation models fit_m <- lm(M ~ X + C, data = mydata) fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M + C, data = mydata) med_data <- extract_mediation(fit_m, model_y = fit_y,                                treatment = "X", mediator = "M")  # Get P_med effect size, confidence intervals, and sensitivity analysis pmed_result <- compute_pmed(med_data) ci_result <- ci(med_data, type = "dop") sensitivity <- sensitivity_analysis(med_data)

title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R
text: Purpose: Unified S7-based infrastructure mediation analysis Status: Phase 4 progress Provides: - S7 classes (MediationData, SerialMediationData, BootstrapResult) - Model extraction lm/glm/lavaan - Bootstrap inference (parametric, nonparametric, plugin) - Type-safe data structures Links: Website | GitHub | Issues

title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R
text: Purpose: Compute P_med, scale-free probabilistic effect size Status: Stable, ready integration Provides: - P_med computation continuous binary outcomes - GLM support (logistic, Poisson) - Integration lavaan mediation packages - Bootstrap confidence intervals Links: Website | GitHub | Issues

title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R
text: Purpose: Asymmetric confidence intervals via Distribution Product Status: Stable CRAN Provides: - Distribution Product (DOP) method - Monte Carlo (MC) confidence intervals - MBCO bootstrap method - Integration standard R models Links: CRAN | Website | GitHub

title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R
text: Purpose: Partial identification differential misclassification Status: development Provides: - Partial identification bounds NDE/NIE - Data-driven falsification tests - Synthetic data generation - Publication-ready visualizations Links: Website | GitHub | Issues

text: Purpose: Standardized infrastructure Monte Carlo studies Status: Core implementation complete Provides: - Environment-aware execution (local/HPC) - Parallel processing progress bars - Ground truth caching - Publication-ready figures LaTeX tables Links: Website | GitHub | Issues

title: mediationverse: Ecosystem for Mediation Analysis in R
code: library(mediationverse)  # 1. Fit mediation models (medfit) fit_m <- lm(M ~ X + C, data = mydata) fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M + C, data = mydata)  # 2. Extract mediation structure (medfit) med_data <- extract_mediation(fit_m, model_y = fit_y,                                treatment = "X", mediator = "M")  # 3. Bootstrap inference (medfit) boot_result <- bootstrap_mediation(med_data, n_boot = 2000)  # 4. Compute probabilistic effect size (probmed) pmed_result <- compute_pmed(med_data)  # 5. Get confidence intervals (RMediation) ci_result <- ci(med_data, type = "dop")  # 6. Sensitivity analysis (medrobust) robust_result <- sensitivity_analysis(med_data)  # 7. Run simulation study (medsim) sim_results <- medsim_run(   method = my_method,   scenarios = medsim_scenarios_mediation(),   config = medsim_config("local") )
